p: A cumulative effect of ATSBs on an anopheline mosquito population was demonstrated for an area with alternative sugar sources resulting in delayed population level lethality as compared to sugar-poor areas [ 54], suggesting its utility in arid environments. A single application of an ATSB affected Anopheles sergentii density, parity, survival, and hence vectorial capacity [ 54]. Potential drawbacks of this strategy might be the effects on nontarget sugar-feeding organisms, as well as the high coverage required. Environmental, safety, and cost estimates are being explored as part of the WHO VCAG requirements for demonstration of public health value ( Table 1).
